AbstractText: 探究成都市大气环境中PM2.5与臭氧交互作用对当地心脑血管疾病死亡影响的健康风险。
利用成都市2014–2016年逐日心脑血管疾病（包括男性和女性）死亡资料、同期气象资料、PM2.5日均浓度和日均臭氧8 h浓度最大值（O<sub>3</sub> 8-h max）资料，采用广义相加模型分析PM2.5和O<sub>3</sub> 8-h max单效应及其二者交互作用对当地心脑血管疾病死亡人数的影响。

累积滞后一天（lag01）的PM2.5和O<sub>3</sub> 8-h max对心脑血管疾病死亡影响的风险均最大，PM2.5(lag01)质量浓度每升高10 µg/m<sup>3</sup>，心脑血管疾病总死亡、男性和女性死亡风险分别增加0.35%、0.26%和0.38%；O<sub>3</sub> 8-h max(lag01)质量浓度每升高10 µg/m<sup>3</sup>，心脑血管疾病总死亡、男性和女性死亡风险分别增加0.66%、0.43%和1.05%。高浓度PM2.5与高浓度O<sub>3</sub> 8-h max共存情况下，心脑血管疾病死亡总人数、男性和女性死亡人数均达到最多。
高浓度PM2.5与高浓度O<sub>3</sub> 8-h max对心脑血管疾病死亡的影响存在协同放大效应。

Journal.Title: Sichuan da xue xue bao. Yi xue ban = Journal of Sichuan University. Medical science edition
Journal.ISOAbbreviation: Sichuan Da Xue Xue Bao Yi Xue Ban

Article.ArticleTitle: [Effects of Interaction between PM2.5 and O <sub>3</sub> 8-h max on Mortality of Cardiovascular Diseases in Chengdu].

AbstractText: To explore the health risks of the interactive effects between PM2.5 and ozone on cardiovascular mortality in Chengdu.

Daily data on the mortality of cardiovascular diseases, including data for both men and women, during 2014-2016 were collected. The meteorological data, the daily average of particulate matter with aerodynamic diameter less than 2.5 micrometers (PM2.5), and the daily ozone 8 h maximum concentration (O <sub>3</sub> 8-h max) in Chengdu of the same period were also collected. Generalized Additive Models (GAMs) were adopted to explore the respective adverse health effects of PM2.5 and O <sub>3</sub> 8-h max and the synergistic effects between PM2.5 and O <sub>3</sub> 8-h max on the mortality of cardiovascular diseases in the city.

The highest health risks of PM2.5 and O <sub>3</sub> 8-h max for mortality of cardiovascular diseases were found to be the strongest for the cumulative effect of the lag of one day (lag01). For every 10 µg/m <sup>3</sup> increment in the mass concentration of PM2.5 (lag01), the associated increase in risks for total, male, and female cardiovascular mortalities was 0.35%, 0.26% and 0.38%, respectively. For every 10 µg/m <sup>3</sup> increment in the mass concentration of O <sub>3</sub> 8-h max (lag01), the associated increase in risks for total, male, and female cardiovascular mortalities was 0.66%, 0.43%, and 1.05%, respectively. The total, male, and female cardiovascular mortalities all reached their maximum values when high concentration of PM2.5 coexisted with high concentrations of O <sub>3</sub> 8-h max.
There was a synergistic amplification effect between high concentrations of PM2.5 and high concentrations of O <sub>3</sub> 8-h max on cardiovascular mortality.
